duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, implement, and maintain the Salesforce/Affinaquest CRM system
Collect and document end-user’s needs and challenges, analyzes business and system processes and procedures to determine root cause
Provide system support and assist users with day-to-day questions, problems, and issues
Lead the process for training new CRM users, which may include campus partners and Deans
Play a key role in CRM system upgrades, including planning, executing, and testing
Ensure optimal performance of Salesforce systems and products
Upgrade and configure Salesforce systems for optimized integration
Manage Salesforce roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows, and groups
Import sales department leads, contacts, and other data
Maintain the sales cloud, as well as build custom reports and dashboards
Perform database maintenance tasks, including diagnostic tests and duplicate entry cleansing
Evaluate and install new Salesforce releases, as well as provide training and support
Partner with Sr. Director of Advancement Services to implement Salesforce/Affinquest CRM System
Maintain current knowledge of the University’s enterprise system addressing interface needs with the CRM and other enterprise applications
Participate in cross-functional teams that address strategic business issues involving CRM operations, admissions best practices, and customer satisfaction
Stay current with practices and processes utilizing current CRM tools
Develop and maintain documentation regarding CRM configuration, business processes, and rules
Work well in a team environment, as well as independently

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field preferred (Master's preferred)
Salesforce certified administrator or Salesforce advanced administrator certification
